item.title: A discussion about Fatherhood and kids
item.description:

item.title: Reading Pragmatic Programmer - Part 2
item.description:
New points for the book

Throughout the book there are some Challenges proposed to the reader as well as exercises to to practice some concepts learned through the book.

There is also Tips that translates the ideas of each one the sections. There are some really useful tips like this one.

Chapter 1, 2 and 3…

These chapters were a very nice beginning for this adventure and left me already with a lot to think, and most important, to do!.

item.title: Reading Pragmatic Programmer
item.description:
It was already time!

I had a copy of the Pragmatic Programmer, in a PDF shitty format. And that was my excuse to no read it.

I have always been keen of the philosoy to credit people for their work. I understand that in Brazil leisure is not that accessible as in other places in the world so I don’t blame people buying recorded movies from cinemas. I understand the struggle.

item.title: I will continue to study Elixir
item.description:
I took part in a selection process in a company that I was really interested in working with.

The process till the last interview was smooth and pretty nice. The end I was a little bit frustrated because was not selected to continue in the process but in the end it was very important for me in a way and I will explain why.

Prologue

I think it is important to point out that I am a Quereinsteiger and came from the chemical Engineering area, so I am probably not the profile you search if you want someone with fluent IT theoretical and algorithmy knowledge.
